name: places/ChIJKy4vOhRawokRjA7GH9DG4iw
formattedAddress: 76 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA
adrFormatAddress: 76 Pearl St, New York, NY 10004, USA

editorialSummary.text: Bakery chain known for late-night deliveries, with some locations selling ice cream.

originalText.text: If you are hankering for a late night sugar rush, or perhaps need a yummy distraction from a project you are working on, Insomnia cookies is that spot. There are a variety of choices in a traditional or deluxe style. Most locations are open until 1am for walk-in and will deliver up to 3am! There are several  pretty yummy vegan options and one that is also Gluten free. They also make ice cream sandwiches with their warm cookies!

text.text: If you are hankering for a late night sugar rush, or perhaps need a yummy distraction from a project you are working on, Insomnia cookies is that spot. There are a variety of choices in a traditional or deluxe style. Most locations are open until 1am for walk-in and will deliver up to 3am! There are several  pretty yummy vegan options and one that is also Gluten free. They also make ice cream sandwiches with their warm cookies!

originalText.text: Absolute disaster. We walked into the store when there were no other customers around, but three staff members were present. Two of them were chatting at the counter and completely ignored us. Not a single hello or even a glance in our direction. The cookies were nothing special and absolutely overpriced. From inside the store, you can see into the back area, which looked very messy. I do not recommend this place at all.

text.text: Absolute disaster. We walked into the store when there were no other customers around, but three staff members were present. Two of them were chatting at the counter and completely ignored us. Not a single hello or even a glance in our direction. The cookies were nothing special and absolutely overpriced. From inside the store, you can see into the back area, which looked very messy. I do not recommend this place at all.

originalText.text: This isn't going to be a nice review. I placed an order twice this week. It was for a birthday and both orders were wrong. When I spoke with the manager, he told me I was not honest because I placed the order at 9:57AM & they don't open until 11AM. Poor guy doesn't even know we can order on-line before opening. The orders were wrong, both of them. This store is awful & the manager is worthless. Try Monika's Cookies, you can thank me later. I spent almost $100.00 with these fools, and they have an attitude with me.  I even called before the order went out and was told it was right. Not worth the money or hassle.

I spent almost $100.00 with these fools, and they have an attitude with me.  I even called before the order went out and was told it was right. Not worth the money or hassle.

originalText.text: Definitely cookies made for those late night snacks. All the flavours are great and the speciality ones are slightly larger in size so they are worth the price. These were nice and warm when we got them so that was a lovely added treat to the cookies.

text.text: Definitely cookies made for those late night snacks. All the flavours are great and the speciality ones are slightly larger in size so they are worth the price. These were nice and warm when we got them so that was a lovely added treat to the cookies.

originalText.text:
Wow!

So, my girlfriend and I were staying in lower Manhattan, and late one Monday evening while we were walking around, we began searching for a place to get a sweet dessert.

We remembered the previous day we passed by this strange-looking shop with a purple sign on its outside advertising INSOMNIA something or another. We remembered it was a dessert place and the fact that it had INSOMNIA in its name kind of told us it would be open late.

We were happy to have found the place as we weaved in and out of the streets near Fraunces Tavern.  As we went inside, we were amazed to see that this was a literal hole-in-the-wall establishment that couldn't hold many people inside.  It consisted of a counter with a menu above it and a freezer behind it that held the different flavors of Ice Cream.

The African-American guy behind the counter (and I mention race to give due credit) was tremendously friendly. He greeted us with a smile, gave us the list of Ice Cream flavors, and even invited us to take a look in the freezer for ourselves.   He really brightened up the ordering process and made us feel happy to be there.

My girlfriend and I ordered the 2-scoop Ice Cream on a brownie.  It came to under $20 for both orders (which is a bit pricey) and as someone who demands a lot of ice cream, I was amazed how filled up I was afterward.

What is also really great is that this dessert is served on a plate and put in a cardboard box so that we were able to easily walk across the street with it and sit at one of the benches and enjoy our Ice Cream.

This was such an incredible find for late-night Ice Cream that we vowed to return upon our next visit to lower Manhattan.

Bravo everyone!
